channel.title: Real on The Outsider's Journey
channel.description: Recent content in Real on The Outsider's Journey

item.title: My friend the Silver fish
item.description: Not two days ago I met a silver fish. I don’t like to share my shower stall with little creatures but I can’t harm them either.

item.title: SVL 1.14: Atlanta Florida Trip
item.description: 25th January 2015   Hi everyone, Recently I’ve been working on a few of my own projects apart from the environmental stuff so I’ve been putting this trip update off.

item.title: SVL 1.13: Starting the New Year
SVL 1.12: Winter and Holiday Greetings
item.description: 19th December 2014 Hi everyone, Winter Solstice is just around the bend. Christmas decorations and songs are in all shops here. But it doesn’t look much like winter.

item.title: SVL 1.11: The City of Angels and San Diego
item.description: 6th December 2014 Hi Everyone, On Sunday night we returned from a memorable and wonderful trip to southern California. Since ‘Merricans celebrate ThanksgivingÂ on the fourth Thursday of November, it becomes a long weekend perfect for travel.

item.title: SVL 1.10: Alterbridge Weekend and East Coast
SVL 1.9: Palo Alto and Cousins
item.description: 13th October 2014 Hello everyone, How are you? Hope you are doing well ðŸ™‚ Here the weather is getting so cold (13C) in the evenings and mornings that we’ve started keeping the windows closed at night.

item.title: SVL 1.8: Bike writing
item.description: 22nd September 2014 Dear all, How are you? The last couple of weeks have been quieter but no less busy. I’ve been looking for a bike and may get one soon.

item.title: SVL 1.7: Mount Madonna, Davenport Beach, San Francisco, Yosemite
SVL 1.6: Two Months in the USA
item.description: 19th August 2014 Hi, How are you? It’s been two months to the day since I moved to the US. Here life is good.

item.title: SVL 1.5: A weekend in Michigan
item.description: 11th August 2014 Dear family and friends, How are you? Two busy weekends have passed since I last wrote to you.

item.title: SVL 1.4: The Great Outdoors and Indoors
item.description: 29th July 2014 After I wrote to you the previous time, we went out and went to DeeDees, a Gujarati restaurant for dinner. Just near where we parked, I took these pictures.

item.title: SVL 1.3: Independence
item.description: 18th July 2014 Dear family and friends ðŸ™‚ How are you? I’ve been happy to hear from more of you recently. Life has taken on more of a normal rhythm now that it’s been ~a month since I landed.

item.title: SVL 1.2: Two weeks in the USA
item.description: 2nd July 2014 Hello everyone, Today I took the drivers’ written test and passed with flying colours. I got all answers correct! I studied hard for the last couple of days although I was preparing using videos even sometime last week.

item.title: Sunnyvale Letters (SVL) 1: Wedding and After
item.description: June 21st 2014 Happy Summer Solstice everyone! ðŸ™‚ I woke up at 5am because of jetlag and my husband, Santosh, is still sleeping. I’ve been wanting to write every day of the last month but things have been so busy.

item.title: LOG 4.4: Defense on Monday
item.description: 11th April 2014 Hello, I submitted my thesis on the 7th of March and my defense is on 14th April, the coming Monday at 11am. I present my studies for half an hour and then face questions from the committee and audience for the next half an hour or so.

item.title: LOG 4.3: Another Publication and Plans
item.description: 13the February, 2014 Hello everyone, I’m happy to report my second paper was accepted for publication today. It will become available in another few weeks. Thesis work is progressing well overall.

item.title: LOG 4.2: The beginning of the End
item.description: 20th December 2013 Hello everyone, So, it’s been a long silence. Three months and no word. How are you? As some of you may have seen on fb, my first first-author paper got accepted a few weeks ago and published this week.

item.title: In loving memory of Ashwini
item.description: This poem was written on July 4th 2011. I finally feel like it ok for the world to see this on her 4th death anniversary.

item.title: LOG 4.1: Thoughts on a rainy afternoon
item.description: 14th September 2013 Hello everyone, I live close to the Uni so my daily space is very small. But recently I have visited my old flatmate Lea in Bremen once for dinner and once for their housewarming party.

item.title: LOG 3.7 Of rain and coming home
item.description: 19th June 2013 The sound, smell and sight of a storm are reassuring and comforting to me. I sit here thousands of miles away listening to Ghanana ghanana from Lagaan for a moment transported to Bangalore.

item.title: LOG 3.6: Five Months
item.description: 8th April 2013 Hi! Yes, it’s been a long time. Nearly 5 months since I last wrote an update email. In November I went to Berlin for my UK visa, and spent whatever hours I was not at work or sleeping on writing a novel.

item.title: Kindness in Oldenburg
item.description: When you live for long enough in different places kindness becomes one of the most things you look for. And kindness seems to be the theme of this small town where I have spent the last ~three and half years.

item.title: Standing Desk Experience: Days 2-4
item.description: I’ve been standing at work all week. My heels hurt by the end of each day and I’m starting to see what my boyfriend meant by needing the softness for the feet.

item.title: Standing Desk Experience: Day 1
item.description: I’ve been reading about how sitting is bad for you for several months now but after reading one more article a couple of days ago, I decided enough is enough, I’m going to make a standing desk, get used to it and live longer.

item.title: Starry night
item.description: The stars are so pure in their brightness tonight. No earthly sources of light can begin to compare. Sirius sparkled in a clean and loud tone as the others seemed to harmonise in the music of the galaxy.

item.title: LOG 3.5: The extraction of Wisdom
item.description: 24th November, 2012 Hello everyone, It’s been a long time since I wrote and I’ve been meaning to but it’s only on this foggy November day that I’ve decided to get to it.

item.title: LOG 3.4: Munich
item.description: Hello, Happy Pillayaar Chathurthi (festival for Ganesha- the elephant headed god) to you and your families ðŸ™‚ I just got back from lunch with my Indian friends.

item.title: A sunbeam child
item.description: Written in August, 2013 Smells of magnified burnt leaves Light tinges of Jasmine The Sun is beautiful, the grass so green The bee patiently collects nectar

item.title: Feel good links
item.description: I’d like to share here some of the interesting links I’ve read recently: This one is the less covered story about ordinary and good Indian men.

item.title: Come dream with me
item.description: What does our country really need? We need to make sure every citizen gets enough to eat, clothe themselves and opportunity to enrich themselves using good quality education, and employment.

item.title: LOG 3.3: To love a guitar
item.description: 6th August, 2012 Hello! Hope you are doing well. I sang in the Vorspiel Abend (Performance evening) with my rapper friend, Sven. I was nervous but it went well.

item.title: 'When names donâ€™t matter' by C.K. Meena
item.description: C.K. Meena is a columnist in The Hindu, one of IndiaÂ´s biggest news papers. She was my teacher when I took up a certificate course in Journalism and we soon became friends.

item.title: LOG 3.2: Music in the Air
item.description: 14th July, 2012 Hello everyone! Every Friday since I last wrote to you I have been going to 22 Otto Suhr Strasse for making music with the band.

item.title: LOG 3.1: Summer Solstice
item.description: 21st June, 2012 Happy Summer Solstice everyone ðŸ™‚ It has been two weeks since I got back to Germany from India. All the trees grew back their leaves in the month I was gone so everything looks and feels alive!

item.title: LOG 2.8: Data Collection (coming home info)
item.description: 14th March, 2012 Hello everyone, ItÂ´s been a month since I last wrote. ItÂ´s been filled with data collection. So what do we do in data collection?

item.title: LOG 2.7: Acapella Abend
item.description: 13th February, 2012 Hello, Europe is getting hit by a cold wave. Last two weeks were pretty severe in places like Ukraine, Poland etc. Oldenburg sunk below 0C and only today it has risen above to a measley 3.

item.title: LOG 2.6: Solistice
item.description: 23rd December, 2011 Hello ðŸ™‚ It is Winter here but there has been only scanty snowfall which secretly fell in the night and looked like frosty icing in the morning, quickly melting away.

item.title: LOG 2.5: Smooth
item.description: 28th November 2011 Hi! How are you all ðŸ™‚ Life cruises smoothly by. A bit too fast; weeks whizz by at an incredible pace. Work is moving smoothly, social life is fun and uncomplicated ðŸ™‚

item.title: LOG 2.4: Time of my life :)
item.description: Hello everyone, It has been an unreasonable amount of time since I last wrote. More than a month! And so many things can happen in a month.

item.title: LOG 2.3: Kramermarkt
item.description: 9th October, 2011 Hello all! It is cold and rainy here as I write. Just last week, I could wear a dress, and yesterday I had to pull out a heavy jacket to go out!

item.title: LOG 2.2: Photos of the Neighbourhood
item.description: 25th September 2011 Hello! Here are some photos of the neighbourhood. We went for a walk today after Maren’s Birthday-cake party. Maren is my flatmate’s girlfriend.

item.title: LOG 2.1: Autumn
item.description: 22nd September 2011 This morning on the radio, I heard a weather report unlike any other. The lady was shouting in German with even some ‘bad words’ which I could recognise about the summer which had more than its share of rain and how horrible it was that the bad weather was continuing into Autumn.

item.title: Introduction to the Indian Caste System
Thoughts about going Vegan
item.description: I was raised vegetarian and my family has been vegetarian for generations. When I was thirteen or fourteen, my parents told me that since I will be travelling when I get older, I could start getting used to meat if I wanted to.

item.title: Amma endrazhaikadha uyirillaye: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a beautiful song which is for mothers from their grateful children. In the movie the character portrayed by Rajani Kanth is taking care of his old mother.

item.title: How to encourage mutual respect between men and women in India
item.description: INTRODUCTION The gang-rape and death of Jyothi Singh Pandey who was previously known in the media as Damini or Nirbhaya, was the tipping point in bringing to focus a long suffered issue of disrespect and violence towards women in India.

item.title: Home Remedies from South India: Miscellaneous
item.description: This is a continuation of the series which started with Hair Care. The other posts covered Eye care, Coughs, Digestive disorders, Head aches, and Skin Care among other topics.

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Fertility and reproductive troubles
item.description: This is a continuation of the series which started with Hair Care. The other posts covered Eye care, Coughs, Digestive disorders, Head aches, and Skin Care among other topics.

item.title: Home Remedies from South India: Honey and Cinnamon's other uses
item.description: This is a continuation of the series which started with Hair Care. The other posts covered Eye care, Coughs, Digestive disorders, Head aches, and Skin Care among other topics.

item.title: LOG 1.24: Coming home :)
item.description: 5th August, 2011 This time next week, I will be home. I can’t tell you how excited I am! When I was translating a song which talked about Idlys in one line, /2011/07/29/balailakka-balailakka-lyrics-and-translation-with-end-notes/ I looked them up to share an image link for those readers who don’t know what it is.

item.title: The only way forward
item.description: I tend to avoid the news when I can. It upsets me and since I can’t do much about most of those issues far away I satisfy myself by trying to live in the best way I can; compassionately, sincerely and respectfully.

item.title: LOG 1.23: End of Semester
item.description: 22nd July, 2011 Hello everyone, Yesterday I wrote the last exam of this Semester! Not sure when I will get results but IÂ´m sure what I did try, I got right.

item.title: LOG 1.21: Musik und Ordnung
item.description: 29th June, 2011 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ I just scored 93% on my first level German exam! Feeling great about it! I have found order (ordunung) in my life and everything is organised in lists and inserted in my Google calendar and on my Napkin-mousepad ðŸ™‚ the furniture in my room is rearranged and everything is clean and tidy.

item.title: LOG 1.22 Boats :)
item.description: 12th July, 2011 Hello, I hope all of you have been well. Life has improved significantly for me since I organised it. I now feel like I have a sense of purpose and

item.title: LOG 1.20: Chickens and Seals
item.description: 13th June, 2011 Hello everyone, It’s been half a year since I left home the second time and luckily I will be back home for some time without as much gap as last time.

item.title: LOG 1.19: Sunsets
item.description: 2nd June, 2011 Hello, This will be a short one. MATLAB week is going surprisingly well and I’m learning a lot without getting frustrated. Only tomorrow left and I find that it has been an easier one than most others.

item.title: LOG 1.18: A friend visits
item.description: 31st May, 2011 Hello, Hope this finds all of you in good health and happiness. Today I had the first day of a MATLAB workshop which will last all week except Thursday which is a holiday for us.

item.title: 'Caste in a different mould' by C.K. Meena
item.description: _C.K. Meena is a columnist in The Hindu, one of IndiaÂ´s biggest news papers. She was my teacher when I took up a certificate course in Journalism and we soon became friends.

item.title: LOG 1.17: Oh wow, Barcelona!
item.description: 11th May, 2011 Ola everyone ðŸ™‚ I have successfully recovered to a state of normalcy after the most amazing and exhausting weekend I can ever remember having!

item.title: LOG 1.16: Barcelona on my mind
item.description: 5th May, 2011 Hello, Tonight I sleep in Bremen Airport to be on time for a very early morning flight to Barcelona where I will meet two of my close friends from my year in Edinburgh … it will be one of their birthdays during the weekend when we will be there and we will be staying with the kind hospitality of the other’s brother.

item.title: LOG 1.15: Rise and Fall
item.description: 22nd April, 2011 Janani’s log; Solar date: 220411.12 Last week I had crammed too many activities into my schedule; attending multiple classes, working on the programming, in aerobics, music group and a Greenpeace meeting.

item.title: LOG 1.14: A Trip to GÃ¶ttingen
item.description: 10th April, 2011 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ I just returned from a trip to GÃ¶ttingen where my flatmates and I celebrated an old flatmate’s birthday. We took a train yesterday morning and I was quite taken in by the beauty of the countryside.

item.title: Spiritual, religious or philosophical?
item.description: Many people confuse spirituality with religiousness, and philosophy with spirituality. Here I will attempt to tease out the differences as I see them. To be religious is to follow a given set of rules generally defined by an existing system of organised faith.

item.title: LOG 1.13: Spring 'time', German and the 60Â´s
item.description: 31st March, 2011 After some rain last night, the air smells like monsoon in India; so fresh and clean! IÂ´ve opened the window to let it come in and along with it are the chirps and tweets of the birds.

item.title: Laughing fits
item.description: A lot of people who know me think I am a pretty serious person. Maybe it’s because I have a tendency to intensify conversations. But as serious/intellectual/deep I get, I can go equally crazy.

item.title: LOG 1.12: DMT, The Discovery of Dro"gen Hasen Weg and the Super Extreme Moon
item.description: 18th March, 2011 Hello everyone, I watched this video recently. http://www.esoterictube.com/dmt-the-spirit-molecule.html It corresponds with what Joseph Campbell says about the spiritual world (as represented by myths and anecdotes from those who meditate, and shamans), drugs and psychological diseases like schizophrenia.

item.title: LOG 1.11: Light jackets and Programing
item.description: 13th March, 2011 Hi Everyone ðŸ™‚ We are halfway through March and temperatures are now ranging between 7-13! Quite warm (relatively) and it is now ok to venture out with either a light jacket with a heavy-ish sweater or with only one heavy jacket on.

item.title: LOG 1.10: The first signs
item.description: 28th February, 2011 Hello, It is now possible to see the first signs of Spring. The trees are bearing buds that will leaf and flower forth.

item.title: 'Garbage out, garbage out' by C.K. Meena
item.description: C.K. Meena is a columnist in The Hindu, one of IndiaÂ´s biggest news papers. She was my teacher when I took up a certificate course in Journalism and we soon became friends.

item.title: LOG 1.9: Aerobics, Music, Star Trek
item.description: 17th February, 2011 Hello everyone, I just came back from an hour of the most exhausting exercise in probably Years! I never realised how out-of-shape I have been until I saw 60 odd other people able to jump around during what they call ‘Power Gym’ for an hour while I was out of breath within 15 minutes.

item.title: LOG 1.8: Missing English and The Tree of Gondor
item.description: 11th February, 2011 Hello all, I got a mobile and landline connection. From my home number I can call landlines all over europe for free! So if you are in Europe, let me know your number and we can have a little phone chat ðŸ™‚

item.title: LOG 1.7: The new place
item.description: 2nd February, 2011 Hello ðŸ™‚ IÂ´ve moved into the new place. My things are finally out of the bags and in well organised shelves! So happy to have things out and well in reach.

item.title: LOG 1.6: Speaking German
item.description: 25th January, 2011 Hallo everyone ðŸ™‚ Hope you are all well and happy as you read this. Here is the latest news from me: The girl I live with got a new cat.

item.title: LOG 1.5: Snow, it turns to rain
item.description: 15th January, 2011 Hello everyone, It has been a while since I last wrote. I’ve been busy seeing houses, working (:O ! :)), and going out with friends.

item.title: About Life and Death
item.description: From August 2008 We assume Immortality. Only a death of someone close to us reminds us of our Impermanence. We make promises and think of ways to make our lives more meaningful, now that weâ€™ve experienced this reminder.

item.title: Eulogy
item.description: August 18th 2008 Who was Sripadrao Uncle? He was a Teacher. But if this is true, then the word â€˜Teacherâ€™ must absorb infinitely From his character, mind and actions.

item.title: LOG 1.4: Beauty and the Beasts
item.description: 30th December, 2010 Hello everyone, Another ‘Old Year’ has gone by … well I hope it was as happy as it could’ve been for everyone. So many things have happened, so many new things have been learnt!

item.title: Letters from Oldenburg, Germany (LOG) 1.3: Holiday seasonâ€¦'A Freeze is coming'
item.description: 22nd December, 2010 Happy Winter Solstice to everyone ðŸ™‚ Most of Europe is experiencing an intense winter with temperatures hardly ever peeking above 0*C. The roads are icy and footpaths in front of those away on holidays are slippery.

item.title: Letters from Oldenburg, Germany 1.2: A Good Week
item.description: 12th December, 2010 Hi Everyone ðŸ™‚ It’s been a strangely wonderful week ðŸ™‚ Things happen here the way they are supposed to. Traffic lanes, bike paths, pedestrian paths.

item.title: An unfeeling mouth
item.description: I canÂ´t feel most of my mouth. My tongue can move but canÂ´t taste or feel touch. My bottom lip feels like my tongue sticking out of my mouth in a constant pout.

item.title: Letters from Oldenburg, Germany 1.1: And so it Begins!
item.description: 6th December, 2010 Hello All!! Winter is a strange season to start a new thing anywhere. Mainly because places seem most uninhabitable in this season. But here I am, sitting in mz new office, struggling with ?

item.title: The Danger of a Single Story
item.description: I think a lot of people can relate to this. http://www.ted.com/talks/lang/por_pt/chimamanda_adichie_the_danger_of_a_single_story.html From an Indian perspective, I think this is definitely worth passing on to those who make a big deal of stories like Slum Dog Millionaire.

item.title: Goodbye Edinburgh, Hello Oldenburg
item.description: This is the beginning of a new series of letters I have sent home. It starts three months after my last letter from Edinburgh when I was about to leave for India.

item.title: Â´Unlucky knock on woodÂ´ by C.K. Meena
item.description: C.K. Meena is a columnist in The Hindu, one of IndiaÂ´s biggest news papers. She was my teacher when I took up a certificate course in Journalism and we soon became friends.

item.title: "What's your deal with Roger Federer?"
item.description: Roger Federer just won his 7th Wimbledon Championship lifting him back to his rightful place as World No. 1. He is the greatest Tennis player of all time.

item.title: A Sleep Deprived Mind
item.description: I woke up early and worked all day. Had very little lunch but instead of eating dinner at eight pm as I normally do, I went to sing with my friends until around eleven thirty in the night.

item.title: The Risks involved in Love and Babies
item.description: I lead a straightforward and simple life. I work, have light conversations with my colleagues during lunch, come back to my flat, cook, hang out with my flatmates or other friends, read, sing, Skype with family and friends in other countries, and watch series like Star Trek and Grey’s Anatomy.

item.title: 7 Steps which will make your blog more popular!
item.description: I love writing. Whether it is pen on paper or finger-tips on keys, the feeling I get when I express myself is uniquely gratifying. In some ways, it doesn’t matter whether people are reading my post or not, because the sheer pleasure of writing is really enough of a motivation.

item.title: Reflections on God 7: Current Beliefs
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Views on other beliefs I retain a relatively moderate view on people who take an external god literally, so long as they never cross the line of violence especially with children, nature or other cultures.

item.title: Reflections on God 6: Radical Atheism
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Radical Atheism After almost a year of intense email exchanges about god with my friend in Sydney, I went to Edinburgh for my Masters in Neuroscience.

item.title: Reflections on God 5: Yoga
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Yoga I took up Yoga classes in the holidays between my BSc and MSc mainly to address a back problem I had developed by using a tilted chair.

item.title: Reflections on God 4: Hindu Mythology and Philosophy
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Ka, Doniger, Joseph Campbell Before entering the waters of atheism again, let me mention the other influences I had during and a little after my undergraduate years.

item.title: Reflections on God 3: The Other Cheek of Christianity
item.description: This is part of God Flux but split into smaller sections for an easier read. The other cheek of Christianity During my undergraduate course, I joined the choir and sang songs praising Jesus.

item.title: Reflections on God 2: Deep Ecology and Buddhism
item.description: This is part of God Flux but written in smaller sections for an easier read. Compassion So I put together my own version of god. Almost an imaginary friend.

item.title: Fair is not Lovely
item.description: Dear Women of India, I hope you will soon learn to laugh at the ads which endorse the notion that having lighter brown skin makes you more beautiful than you are already.

item.title: Reflections on God 1: Childhood Atheism and Introduction to Kabir Poetry
item.description: This is part of God Flux but written in smaller sections for an easier read. Basic Atheism As a child I was taught to worship Hindu gods in temples and during Poojas (auspicious days/festivals) at home.

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Cancer
item.description: This is a continuation of the series which started with Hair Care. The other posts covered Eye care, Coughs, Digestive disorders, Head aches, and Skin care among other topics.

item.title: God Flux; Reflection on a Spiritual Journey
item.description: I have wondered about the concept of god all my life so far. I would like to describe and reflect on my journey so far.

item.title: Little Baby Ten Days Old
item.description: May 2008, dedicated to my niece. . Little baby 10 days old You squirm around in my lap Frown and smile without reason Pee and poo without warning

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Eye care
item.description: This is a continuation of the series which started with Hair Care.Â The other posts include information about Colds, Coughs, Foot problems and Headaches. The information in this series is the knowledge of my grandmother, which I documented as part of a project on medicinal plants and home remedies.

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Skin care
item.description: This is a continuation of the series which started with Hair Care. The other posts covered Colds, Coughs, Foot, Head aches, among other topics. The information in this series is the knowledge of my grandmother, which I documented as part of a project on medicinal plants and home remedies.

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Headaches
item.description: This is a continuation of the series which started with Hair Care. The other posts covered Colds, Coughs and Foot problems. The information in this series is the knowledge of my grandmother, which I documented as part of a project on medicinal plants and home remedies.

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Feet
item.description: This is the fourth in a series which started with Hair Care. The other two posts cover Colds and Coughs. The information in this series is the knowledge of my grandmother, which I documented as part of a project on medicinal plants and home remedies.

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Coughs
item.description: This is the third post in the series which started with Hair Care. The second of which was on Colds. The information in this series is the knowledge of my grandmother, which I documented as part of a project on medicinal plants and home remedies.

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Colds
item.description: This is a continuation of the series which started with Hair Care. The information in this series is the knowledge of my grandmother, which I documented as part of a project on medicinal plants and home remedies.

item.title: Home Remedies from flora in south India: Hair Care
item.description: In my 12th grade, I did a project on the medicinal plants in my school campus with two of my classmates. As an add-on to that, we were asked to collect home remedies from people in our families.

item.title: Frames of Reference
item.description: A colleague of mine is taking German lessons and when the topic of poetry came up at lunch, he described Elftans, and their structure. It reminded me a little of Haiku so I said Â¨Sounds like the European version of HaikuÂ¨.

item.title: LfE 27: Home
item.description: 22/08/2010 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ I hope everything is going well with all of you. This is the final mail I’ll send from Edinburgh to all of you because my magical and memorable year has come to an end.

item.title: LfE 26: Amsterdam and realisation of love
item.description: 11/07/2010 Hello I write less and less often nowadays mainly because I’m more busy but also because theres more of the same type of things happening.

item.title: The conversation I have with every German
item.description: Everyone here wants to know why I am here. It always goes almost exactly like this; Â¨So where are you from?Â¨ Â¨IndiaÂ¨ Â¨Which part?Â¨ I wonder if they know Indian geography at all.

item.title: LfE 25: Swift time
item.description: 21/05/2010 Hello! Looks like it really has been a month since I last wrote! And what a busy month it’s been! Various assignments, deadlines, work with project and otherwise, workshops on new software, just so much…of everything has happened!

item.title: LfE 24: Volcano Sunset
item.description: 20/04/2010   Hello, As you all probably know, the Iceland Volcano continues to erupt disrupting flights all over northern Europe. My flatmate who was supposed to go to Germany for part of her PhD has been grounded here.

item.title: This is water â€“ David Foster Wallace
item.description: I read this recently and found it wise. http://moreintelligentlife.com/story/david-foster-wallace-in-his-own-words

item.title: LfE 23: Spring in full swing
item.description: 05/04/2010 Hello everyone, We passed the Equinox on the 21st of March. We celebrated and welcomed spring in full swing. Daffodils now grow where the White and purple flowers did.

item.title: Sparkling water
item.description: Water used to be free. In some parts of the world it still is but with all the pollution and diseases, it is becoming increasingly difficult to safely drink straight from a river, and in many parts of the world, from the tap.

item.title: LfE 22: To the new apartment
item.description: 12/03/2010 Hi So the shift happened a week ago. The new house is well set now and quite nice. I have assimilated the neighbourhood and cognitively accepted my surroundings.

item.title: LfE 21: Season of Lifeâ€¦ Under my Skin
item.description: 03/03/2010 Hello everyone, I’m halfway through my stay here in Edinburgh and every day brings me closer to the day I can come back home to Bangalore and hug my family.

item.title: LfE 20: Dundee
item.description: 25/02/2010 I went to Dundee for a training session for the postgrad review job that I have. It snow-stormed in the morning. Wild winds. Train was good.

item.title: "And who, in God's name, is He?" A Book Review on 'Ka'
item.description: ByÂ N.S.Jagannathan Ka: Roberto Calasso. Translated from original Italian by Tim Parks. Vintage Paperback 1999 Pages 448. Price $ 3. . Amidst the deafening din of post-Colonial chatter on the dark designs of Orientalists “colonising the source textsâ€, of the colonised, I am all the time nagged by a niggling doubt: how literate are these critics in Sanskrit and other native Indian languages?

item.title: On a Snowy morning
item.description: When I was 7 and I was about to fly to Australia, I told my grandparents that I will bring some clouds back with me for them.

item.title: Adult
item.description: 25th May 2007 I suddenly realize I am a machine. I do the same things everyday. Iâ€™ve stopped feeling. Iâ€™ve stopped thinking. Iâ€™m too busy with my life.

item.title: Buses
item.description: From October 2008 The Bus 1 I stand in the bus The crowd sways behind me My dupatta catches the flow But oh! Now the flow chokes me.

item.title: You Tear It Up
item.description: From Feb 2009 You tear it up I pick up the pieces and reuse You listen to cruel experiments without flinching I feel sick and want to cry

item.title: For Now
item.description: October 2008 This yellow evening, Winds tell of rains to come. A healthy, happy wind That I havenâ€™t felt for so long. Dry mango leaves

item.title: Jalanethi
item.description: Jala= water (Sanskrit) Nethi= clean (Sanskrit) For the past few months I have been practicing Jalanethi. It is part of Yoga but to my surprise, I find people of other countries also practice it under different names: Nasa dusche or Nasal Irrigation.

item.title: Our part in world violence (Tibet)
item.description: From May 11, 2008 Violence and aggression rise from fear and greed. What gives the Chinese the right to violate human rights? To kill and torture people?

item.title: God and Love
item.description: From April 2008: Words like love and god are of the most ambiguous. What do people mean when they ask â€˜do you believe in godâ€™ or say â€˜I love youâ€™.

item.title: A Study of Communalism and Identity
item.description: A Study of Communalism and Identity (First published in May 2008) I Identities Preferences and Behaviour Where does the self come from? Identity and our definitions of our â€˜selfâ€™ are a result of what weâ€™ve been taught from the beginning of our lives.

item.title: Existence
item.description: From December 2007 I think that wasting time is criminal. Somehow, there has to be a purpose to everything. And when there is none, I feel like I donâ€™t deserve to exist.

item.title: Idealism knocked down
item.description: From November 2007 Channel the feelings into art and in that preoccupation, the feelings are absorbed more easily; like a flood, which suddenly found the porous route to the storm drains.

item.title: City Streets
item.description: From October 2007 Vehicle fumes bathe me as I walk the city streets. The roars of blue and white paid concentration cells, and lorries carrying rough blocks of granite vibrate my stomach.

item.title: Anger
item.description: First published in August 2008 Anger. Like a vengeful human on a leash If you were to be freed What damage, what destructionâ€¦ What chaos.

item.title: Reflection
item.description: First published on October 2007 I look for my reflection I love my reflection. It isnâ€™t me but my only companion Through life. And sometimes it is me.

item.title: Missing Mountains
item.description: First published in September 2007 . This prison. Walls. No trees. No where to hide To be alone or cry. No one to understand the loverâ€™s yearning for the mountains

item.title: City
item.description: Written in December 2006 . There is no wholesome plant here There is no learning No passion. Being with the dead kills me. . There aren’t enough trees

item.title: Silver Haired Goddess
item.description: (Written about my grandmother October 2006) The sun lights up her silver hair She walks gracefully past in her fresh light sari. She’s a goddess from above.

item.title: A Passing Thought about 'Chicks' and 'Babes'
LfE 19: Work and Tea
item.description: 22/02/2010 Hello everyone, It’s been a long time since I last wrote, partly because I’ve not been doing too much of new things – the project develops, and software glitches occur daily that I patiently overcome.

item.title: Flakes
item.description: Written in Feb 2007 The season changes Clouds cover parts of The sky. I lose peace. Moisture in the wind Falling leaves; dry and Brittle. Wait for rain.

item.title: The Amazon and us
item.description: First published on August 12, 2007 _â€œIn the time it takes to sing this song, Thereâ€™ll be four acres cleared in the Amazon. The jungle burns all through the night,

item.title: Earth
item.description: June 5th 2008: There is vulnerability In the bud, and Small new leaves. In all young, Newborns sprouting Into Life. There is freshness in Water- life-giving

item.title: At the Neem Tree
item.description: August 12, 2007 . . I walk to my Friends in silence, Drop my bag and jacket on the way Carelessly let loose my hair.

item.title: LfE 18: Activities and work place
item.description: 07/02/2010 Hello ðŸ™‚ It snowed one morning unexpectedly. It is Feb so I thought all that weather is over. But it lasted an hour and melted within the next two days.

item.title: LfE 17: Brain Scan
item.description: 26/01/2010 Hello, It feels like a long time since I wrote. My project is now developing and I have a better clue about what it is about.

item.title: LfE 16: Back in Edinburgh
item.description: 12/01/2010 Hi everyone, Hope you all had a good holiday. I’m back in Edinburgh, this familiar and beautiful city. I actually have developed a kind of loyalty to it.

item.title: LfE 15: A visit to Oxford and Thoughts in Slough
item.description: 29/12/2009 Hello ðŸ™‚ I have been in Slough, a town near London, for around two weeks now. It has been restful to spend time with family, watch movies, go shopping etc.

item.title: Chopin's Nostalgia: Ballade No. 2 in F Major op. 38
item.description: Chopin has always been the most real sound track of my life. I got to know some of his most popular pieces as a nine year old in Australia when Reader’s Digest sent the CD for my mum.

item.title: LfE 14: Traveling to Slough
item.description: 15/12/2009 Hello everyone! Hope this letter finds you all in good health. My adventures are more mobile now. I’m on the train to Slough to visit family for the holidays.

item.title: LfE 13: The last day and the Bicycle story
item.description: 06/12/2009 Hello! It’s nearly noon on this bright sunshiny Sunday. The temperature is 8 Degrees Celsius. Last night it hit an unusual 9 degrees! I had planned to pull out my gloves only after December started but I remember November days being colder than this!

item.title: LfE 12: Weekend activities
item.description: 29/11/2009 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ It’s a Sunday. Four degrees celsius as I write, and cloudy. A bunch of us friends are going to the German market today on Princes Street.

item.title: LfE 11: Glasgow and Animal Handling
item.description: 18/11/2009 Hello everyone! This time I have more to say ðŸ™‚ I have a laptop now. Acer Aspire…metallic midnight blue…itâ€™s my first ever so I’m very attached, and loving to it.

item.title: The First and Last Freedom (TFALF) 3: Thoughts during "Individual and Society"
item.description: Is the individual an instrument of society or does the society exist for the individual? In the first paragraph K creates this black and white sense of options.

item.title: LfE 10: Enormous Work Load and Frost
item.description: 09/11/20009 Hi! Itâ€™s me again ðŸ™‚ All is well with me and I hope you are all equally well. The pressure in Uni to get work done has suddenly risen exponentially and the weather is getting colder by the day.

item.title: LfE 9: Halloween and the True Colours of the Weather
item.description: 01/11/2009 Hello everyone! My cough is completely gone. It took its own time and I waited patiently ðŸ™‚ Last night was Halloween. We were out all night partying.

item.title: LfE 8: Gifford Lectures and Indian Festivities
item.description: 23/10/2009 Greetings! I recover from a cough as I write this. The reason for the long silence is the fever I had last weekend. I know you kind-hearted people are starting to worry already!

item.title: LfE 7: No news isâ€¦
item.description: 12/10/2009 Hello!! Itâ€™s been a while it seems since my last update. All is well on this side of the world. I am cocooned in academic life and donâ€™t hear the news very often.

item.title: What I learnt from my Grandmother
item.description: On Gandhi’s birthday I think of two people. One is my cousin who shares his birthday and the other is my maternal grandma who taught me most of what I know about Gandhian values.

item.title: LfE 6: Classes are Intense
item.description: 04/10/2009 Hello everyone! The weather this week albeit two days in the middle has been pleasant with sunny blue skies. This is most unexpected in Edinburgh but a joy to us although the wind can be a real bully while walking; pushing us forward and backward with no warning!

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh (LfE) 5: Settled and Rocking!
item.description: **28/09/2009 JANANI IS SETTLED AND ROCKING!** Hello everyone! I’m well and I hope you are all in a well too :):) (Sorry, I had to crack that ðŸ™‚ )

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 4
item.description: **22/09/2009 EDINBURGH PART 4: ZAPPED** Hi! I had my first classes today so after an all-girls Birthday party (of our new American friend) last night with yum brownies, I organised my things for today and slept as early as possible.

item.title: Oldenburg: The Neighbourhood and Trees
item.description: [slideshow]

item.title: The First and Last Freedom 2: Thoughts during 'What are we seeking?'
item.description: What do we want in life? Many people would say ‘to be happy’. K asks whether we know the difference between happiness and gratification. He says:

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 3
item.description: **19/09/2009 THE BEGINNING: PART 3** Hello all! It has been nearly 10 days since I got here. Freshersâ€™ week was very fun! I went for lots of cool events where we got to meet people from all sorts of fields from genomics to international politics and everything in between!

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 2
item.description: **13/09/2009 THE BEGINNING: PART 2** Hello! I just got back from a great time at three events. I climbed Arthurâ€™s Seat and made a friend (Greek) who’s about to start studying Bachelors of Computer science and met a Londoner who studies Geology.

item.title: The First and Last Freedom: Thoughts during Chapter 1
item.description: Different approaches are necessary for different types of books; Novels and most popular science books are meant to be read cover to cover. Dictionaries, encyclopedias and other factual texts are meant to be looked up for specific information.

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 1
item.description: In the posts that follow this, will be the letters I wrote to family and friends when I was in Edinburgh for my MSc in Neuroscience.

item.title: Understanding India using Europe
item.description: It is too difficult for a European to see India as one country when they understand it’s diversity is more at the scale of a continent – their continent.

item.title: Android body vs Human body
item.description: A lot of futuristic science fiction puts forward several ideas of what an android would be like. Data from Star Trek (TNG) is an intriguing character who tries very hard to understand what it is to be human.

item.title: Arranged Marriage
item.description: Arranged marriage is an old concept. It existed long before people accepted love (that occurred before marriage) as a valid reason to marry. The process through which this changed is reflected very well in the movie ‘Fiddler on the Roof’.

item.title: Balailakka Balailakka â€“ Lyrics and Translation (with end notes)
item.description: A.R. Rahman had another party with this movie. He has explored several new styles including hip pop in the movie Shivaji â€“ The Boss. Although it has some lines just for the sake of rhyming lyrics(I will mark these with a â€˜*â€™), this song makes me long for home.

item.title: Types of Love: An Analysis.
item.description: It is perhaps important to differentiate the various meaning that we refer to when we say the word love. Often ‘love’ is used in the place of a more suitable word.

item.title: What is a Golusu? Gopuram? and a Kolam?
item.description: In my most recent translation of the Tamil song ‘Ennavalay adi Ennavalay’, I found some references to words which are impossible to directly translate into English.

item.title: My first Entrepreneurship workshop
item.description: Yesterday I was in Bremen for my first Entrepreneurship workshop. I had heard of them ever since my undergrad but I was never that interested in it back then.

item.title: Anbe Sivam Lyrics Translation
item.description: The movie this song is from is also called Anbe Sivam. It is one of Kamal HassanÂ´s most poignant movies and I recommend it to everyone if they can find it with subtitles.

item.title: Musical styles.
item.description: It is a strange relationship humans share with music. Music isn’t to convey any rational point. It is a form of expression which is artistic and more emotional in nature.

item.title: The Sound of Music: Over the Years
item.description: I watched The Sound of Music today after a long time and I realised that each time I have watched it, I have found new meaning in it.

item.title: Acknowledging Our Biology
item.description: Why is it that humans have a habitual tendency to ignore the biological necessities of their everyday life? We treat bodily excretions as disgusting and excuse ourselves when we must use the toilet or when we sneeze.

item.title: No Two Sunsets Are Ever the Same
item.description: August 30th 2008 Everything passes Good and bad, Small and big, Everything. The easiest thing to do is let them pass. Holding on is an effort.

item.title: Humans vs Other creatures
item.description: Are humans better than other creatures? Do we have the right to use them for drug testing and experimentation? Are humans a plague that Earth would be better off without?

item.title: Boosting Mental Health services in India
item.description: I attended a lecture on CBT- Cognitive Behavioural Therapy and how it is being made accessible in Scotland. Check the website below. http://www.livinglifetothefull.com/index.php?section=page&page_seq=13 Can we bring this to India?
